3: The sound of children laughing and running can be heard in the freshly renovated abandoned mall.
...Gotcha!
Hold it, let me put this one!
Hey, wait! Stop chasing Xi, you're gonna startle them!
Then tell them to stay put for a second, Nanami!
That's up to them! And if you wanna be friends with Xi, you should try to be gentler!
Nanami... Should we pat them the way you do?
Argh... But Xi don't want to come close to us at all...
Give them time! Whether it's getting interested in humans, or getting close to them...
It's gonna be a process! Yep! That's how it is!
You're cute, sure, but those critters are just like you! They're new to the world, and everything is unfamiliar!
So... they're also... children?
You can say that! Newly born, they're just starting to be aware of the world... just like you!
You have to get along with each other, just like what you're doing now!
Nanami, they're trying to run away again! I-I still have something else I want to give them!
Shh! Deckard, quieter! Do what Nanami just said—take your time!
Taking my time, taking my time... Um, Nanami...
The children turn around and look at Nanami, who is deep in thought.
Like being suddenly snapped awake, Nanami joins their fray with utmost excitement as the children look at her with anticipation.
Alright, if you want to get along with them, Nanami can't sit by and do nothing!
Leave it to the almighty Nanami!
She gently pats the small approaching mechanoids and gestures to the children to pass her the decorations they made.
The festivity-loving Xi gather around with Nanami and the children, and they look especially precious in the apocalyptic world.
...If only we could keep playing like this for the rest of this year.
Nanami falls backward onto the stacks of gifts and red envelopes, and she gazes at the sky, her mind adrift.
Hmm? Ayla? Hello!
Hello! Nanami, it's been a while! Are you on a mission to the surface?
Nanami tilts her head and thinks, looking at the Xi running everywhere.
...Sort of? I guess this is a mission, more or less... You know what? Yeah, Nanami is indeed on an important mission!
Ayla does not pay much attention to Nanami's speech to herself. She just takes out a pair of red couplets from her bag.
I was trying to find you in your room earlier today only to find out you weren't there. I've prepared some New Year decorations for you!
Couplets! They're so well written! Did you write them, Ayla?

Of course not. It's from Yuan Ye, the CUB who was with you. Asimov said that being in contact with you guys has introduced it information on Lunar New Year, but I don't really understand what he was saying.
I see! I can't believe that it's not just cute, it's also super smart!
Right? I also think it's cute, but nobody seems to appreciate it... By the way, do you want me to put the couplets on for you?
Um, sure...
She thinks for a second before shaking her head.
Maybe not!
Nanami wants to go back to Babylonia to do it herself! That's what makes it meaningful!
Alright, then. I'll leave them on your desk!
II have to head to my next stop to give out more couplets. Goodbye, Nanami! Happy New Year!
Happy New Year, Ayla!
Nanami does a kip-up from the pile after she hangs up, and she stands steadily on the ground.
In that case, Nanami has to take a trip to Babylonia, or else it would be very impolite!

Nanami is not sure why her free-spirited self needs to find an excuse to convince herself to return to Babylonia—perhaps something has changed, or maybe nothing has—not her, not Babylonia. Regardless...
I get to see everyone again! That's wonderful... Maybe I should pull a prank on the commandant again! What do I do this time...
